questions Sebastian Rodriguez Dr. Sebastian Rodriguez Senior Lecturer in Computer Science See full profile Details College: School of Computing Technologies Department: School of Computing Technologies Campus: City Campus Australia sebastian.rodriguez@rmit.edu.au ORCID: 0000-0002-0514-9221 Open to Masters Research or PhD student supervision Industry Projects Collaborative projects About I am an active researcher in the fields of Software Engineering for AI, Intelligent Agents and Human-Machine Teaming. In those areas I have contributed to methodologies (i.e., steps to follow to create a solution system from requirements to implementation); models for agent systems (i.e., how to represent solutions) and agent programing languages (i.e., how to implement solutions). I strongly believe in research translation to practical applications. I have collaborated with a wide range of government agencies and industrial partners to solve real-world problems in domains such as energy management, logistics, human-AI interaction and more. Expand for full bio Collapse bio Research fields 460202 Autonomous agents and multiagent systems 4612 Software engineering 460207 Modelling and simulation 461208 Software testing, verification and validation 4602 Artificial intelligence Academic positions Program Manager RMIT University School of Computing Technologies Melbourne, Australia 1 Jan 2020 – 4 Oct 2024 Supervisor projects Human-Machine Teaming in communication degraded or denied environments 26 Nov 2025 Using behavioural insights in the modelling of self-evacuation from bushfire 7 Apr 2025 Scaling Residential Analysis of Urban Liveability and Sustainability Indicators From Local to Global 17 Sep 2021 Using Speech Interfaces to Support Human Task Performance in Complex Training Environments 9 Jun 2019 Teaching interests I have been involved in a wide range of courses, including Programming Bootcamp 1 and 2 Software Engineering Fundamentals Software Engineering Process and Tools Research interests Software Engineering for AI Human-Machine Teaming Complex system modeling and simulation Simulaiton of Human Behaviour Agent oriented programming languages (http://www.sarl.io) Industrial applications of AI Initiatives and links https://www.linkedin.com/in/sebastianrodriguez/ http://www.sebastianrodriguez.com.ar/ Acknowledgement of Country RMIT University acknowledges the people of the Woi wurrung and Boon wurrung language groups of the eastern Kulin Nation on whose unceded lands we conduct the business of the University. RMIT University respectfully acknowledges their Ancestors and Elders, past and present. RMIT also acknowledges the Traditional Custodians and their Ancestors of the lands and waters across Australia where we conduct our business - Artwork 'Sentient' by Hollie Johnson, Gunaikurnai and Monero Ngarigo.
